Description: Fragment of a clay seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows a darker discolouration. On the rear impressions of basketry and a string. The front side of the sealing is flat and the side shows a finger impression from pressing the clay against the object to be sealed. At the top an almost complete seal impression from an oval scarab-like seal. Visible is a circumferential line and a standing frontal faced figure in the middle, probably a Bes, wearing a crown, hands in the hip. The upper part of the crown is not preserved. The figure is framed on four sides by each four lines running in a slight convex curve towards the centre of the seal.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), Temple, hypostyle hall, redim
